alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ASHLAND AND NORTHEASTERN SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Winter, or 13 miles east of Chippewa Flowage East, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Ashland and northeastern Sawyer Counties, including the following locations... Blaisdell Lake, Moose Lake Sawyer County and Loretta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
